isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - BUSHING REPLACEMENT - THREE-PIECE BEAM END ADAPTER WITH RUBBER BUSHING, U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2, RS

svcproc.title: THREE-PIECE BEAM END ADAPTER WITH RUBBER BUSHING, U/UE, RT/RTE, RT2/RTE2, RS

step1.para: Raise axles and support vehicle by the frame. Use frame stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being per- formed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Remove wheels from the axle on the side that is being serviced (front or rear depending on the beam end being serviced). Refer to Group 17-RIMS, WHEELS and TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Apply a penetrating oil to the beam end hardware. Then remove the through bolt locknut, washers and bolt ( Figure 13and Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Thru Bolt Locknut, Washers and Bolt

calloutgroup.callout1: 7.INTERMEDIATE TUBE (DO NOT ATTEMPT TO INSTALL ADAPTERS WITHOUT THE INTERMEDIATE TUBE)

figure.caption: Figure 14. Thru Bolt, Bushings and Nut

step1.para: Turn the adapter with the air hammer chisel to locate the reliefs for entry of the chisel ( Figure 15).

If the adapter does not turn, use a hammer to rap the outside of the axle bracket legs around the adapter area, then repeat with the air hammer chisel. When the adapter has space between the axle bracket and the adapter flange, use a bent chisel to wedge and force the adapter out.

warning.para: Support the other end of the beam, so that it does not drop and cause damage or injury when the adapter is removed from that end.

note.para: Always discard used adapters; do not reuse them.

step1.para: Place a jack under the beam close to the center, then remove the nuts/washers securing the saddle caps. Then remove caps and lower beam until beam end clears bracket for tool access.
Use special tool per tool instructions; remove beam end. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS, Figure 44, Figure 45, and Figure 46.
Clean beam end. Use emery cloth to clean burrs and marks, and smooth beam end.

Use emery cloth to remove the rust-preventative phosphate coating from the outer surface of the replacement bushing metal sleeve. Then coat the outside metal with white lead or grease to facilitate pressing the new bushing into the beam bore.
Use special tool per tool instructions. Install beam end bushing.
Install one adapter through the axle bracket leg on the wheel side into the beam end bushing.
Install the other adapter through the axle bracket leg at the bowl side with the bolt and washer. Use the clearance provided by the adapter flange cut-off to clear the bowl.
Tighten beam end bolt/nut. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Install wheels. Refer to Group 17-RIMS, WHEELS and TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove stands and put vehicle back into service.
